summary: This is an email from the Department of Justice's Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) to the Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, transmitting OPR's draft report regarding the handling of the Jeffrey Epstein matter by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida from 2006-2008. The document serves as a cover letter for the report.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure in the matter being reviewed by OPR regarding the handling of his case by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida.

events.title: Handling of Epstein matter by SD Florida
events.description: The period during which the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida handled the Jeffrey Epstein case, which is the subject of the OPR draft report.

events.title: OPR transmits draft report to SDNY
events.description: The Office of Professional Responsibility sends its draft report on the handling of the Epstein matter to the Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York for review.

keyFacts: The Department of Justice's Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) conducted a review of the handling of the Jeffrey Epstein matter by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida.
A draft report of OPR's findings was completed and transmitted to the Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York on August 6, 2020.
The correspondence indicates an internal DOJ review of prosecutorial conduct in the early Epstein case.
The document references the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida's role in the Epstein matter during the specified timeframe.
